channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Q-points, selective ultrafilters, and idempotents, with an application to choiceless set theory
item.description: arXiv:2412.13499v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study ultrafilters from the perspective of the algebra in the \v{C}ech-Stone compactification of the natural numbers, and idempotent elements therein. The first two results that we prove establish that, if $p$ is a Q-point (resp. a selective ultrafilter) and $\mathscr F^p$ (resp. $\mathscr G^p$) is the smallest family containing $p$ and closed under iterated sums (resp. closed under Blass--Frol\'{\i}k sums and Rudin--Keisler images), then $\mathscr F^p$ (resp. $\mathscr G^p$) contains no idempotent elements. The second of these results about a selective ultrafilter has the following interesting consequence: assuming a conjecture of Blass, in models of the form $\mathbf{L}(\mathbb R)[p]$ where $\mathbf{L}(\mathbb R)$ is a Solovay model (of $\mathsf{ZF}$ without choice) and $p$ is a selective ultrafilter, there are no idempotent elements. In particular, the theory $\mathsf{ZF}$ plus the existence of a nonprincipal ultrafilter on $\omega$ does not imply the existence of idempotent ultrafilters, which answers a question of DiNasso and Tachtsis (Proc. Amer. Math. Soc. 146, 397-411). Following the line of obtaining independence results in $\mathsf{ZF}$, we finish the paper by proving that $\mathsf{ZF}$ plus "every additive filter can be extended to an idempotent ultrafilter" does not imply the Ultrafilter Theorem over $\mathbb R$, answering another question of DiNasso and Tachtsis from the same paper.
item.dc:creator: David Fern\'andez-Bret\'on, Jareb Navarro-Castillo, Jes\'us A. Soria-Rojas

item.title: Links represented by phases of algebraic curves
item.description: arXiv:2311.11835v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The prime motivation behind this paper is to prove that any torus link can be realized as the union of the one-dimensional connected components of the set of critical values of the argument map restricted to a complex algebraic plane curve. Moreover, we give an explicit relation between the Newton polygon of such plane curves, and the number of components of the given torus link. This work aims to represent the starting point for a connection between knot theory, tropical geometry, and (co)amoebas.
item.dc:creator: Yen-Kheng Lim, Mounir Nisse
